Services.title: Services
Services.content: User Interface Design of Agent Portal

Overview.title: Overview
Overview.content: The Servex Agent Portal was designed to streamline call center operations by combining multiple tools into a single, intuitive platform. Agents previously struggled with scattered workflows, switching between different dashboards for dialing, follow-ups, and reporting. My role as a UI/UX Designer was to simplify these processes through research, wireframing, and high-fidelity design in Figma. The portal brings together campaign management, a built-in dialer, customer tracking, and performance reports into one interface, helping agents work faster and enabling supervisors to monitor results more effectively.

listData.title: Research
listData.content: To understand agent needs, I conducted quick interviews with 5 agents and 2 supervisors. Their main pain points included slow navigation, missed follow-ups, and difficulty interpreting reports. I also reviewed competitor dashboards like Zoho and Freshdesk to identify best practices. These insights shaped the portal’s structure, ensuring tasks were completed in 2–3 clicks with simplified reporting.

listData.title: Information Architecture
listData.content: I structured the portal into clear modules: Dashboard, Dialer, Customers, Follow-ups, and Reports. This hierarchy helped agents quickly find what they need while giving supervisors a top-level view. User flows were mapped to ensure that common tasks like campaign selection or logging follow-ups required minimal steps, reducing time spent navigating.

listData.title: Wireframing and Prototyping
listData.content: I began with low-fidelity wireframes to test layout options and flows. After validating the structure with stakeholders, I created high-fidelity prototypes in Figma using consistent grids, typography, and color schemes. Interactive prototypes demonstrated the portal’s workflows, helping refine usability before moving into final design.

Challenges.title: Challenges
Challenges.content: Designing the Servex Agent Portal came with multiple challenges, from managing complex workflows to ensuring a smooth experience for both agents and supervisors. Since the platform had to handle large volumes of data while remaining user-friendly, it required careful planning of structure, interactions, and visuals. Here are some key challenges and how they were solved:

content.title: Challenge
content.content: Agents accessed the portal on different devices, making it difficult to ensure consistency.

content.title: Solution
content.content: Applied responsive design with flexible grids and scalable UI components, ensuring the portal worked seamlessly on desktops and tablets.

content.title: Challenge
content.content: The dashboard contained too much information, overwhelming agents.

content.title: Solution
content.content: Used progressive disclosure, showing essential KPIs upfront while allowing drill-down for detailed reports.

content.title: Challenge
content.content: Agents had to switch between multiple dashboards to perform simple tasks.

content.title: Solution
content.content: Unified core functions (dialer, follow-ups, reports) into a single streamlined portal, reducing clicks and improving speed.

content.title: Challenge
content.content: Supervisors lacked clarity in monitoring team performance and daily activities.

content.title: Solution
content.content: Designed interactive charts, color-coded KPIs, and consolidated reports for clear performance tracking.

ResultsConclusion.title: Results/Conclusion
ResultsConclusion.content: The Servex Agent Portal design successfully improved agent productivity and supervisor visibility. Agents were able to complete tasks faster with reduced navigation, while supervisors benefited from simplified reporting and analytics. The clean, responsive UI led to positive feedback from the team, and onboarding for new agents improved by 30%. With its unified structure and modern visuals, the portal became a reliable and efficient tool for daily call center operations. Ongoing updates and user testing will continue to ensure its effectiveness and scalability.
